title: Dear Riot, can we please stop sharing a single splash across multiple skins.

embed.description: The PBE has been updated! Continue reading for more information! ( Warning: PBE Content is tentative and iterative - what you see may not reflect what eventually gets pushed to live servers! Manage your expectations accordingly. ) ! ! * Remember *: The PBE is a testing grounds for new, tentative, and sometimes radical changes.

body:
I check Surr@20 to see the details of the new PBE update to see that you guys already have the splash out for the new Arcade skins, but I have to say I'm extremely disappointed. Except for the characters themselves (who are very well illustrated, well done there), the splash is extremely boring. There's nothing happening other than them posing. The background is a pattern over a purple gradient and nothing else, which is really lackluster after the amazing Arcade MF and Final Boss Veigar splash arts. 
**Edit:** I'd like to expand on the MF and Veigar example. Their splash arts actually have something happening in them. Veigar is descending upon the land on a tetris piece to destroy and conquer. Miss Fortune sits in a glorious arcade throne with Gangplank in the background glaring angrily at her. In comparison, this splash for Riven/Blitzcrank has them illustrated independently and thrown onto a seemingly unrelated background. _Nothing is happening_

The worst part of the splash is that it's _one splash_ for _two 1350 RP skins._ You have two 1350 skins here, the least you could do is give them their own cool splash arts. This is becoming an alarmingly common occurrence among your recent skins. I get it with the cheaper 750 skins where they're nothing THAT fancy, but you have two much more expensive skins here. People pay the extra money for skins like this because of all the effort gone into them and how nice they look because of the effort. The splash art seems like a small part of a skin, but it's still a lot to cheap out on, especially when you're paying $15 for it.

**TL;DR**: The splash for the two new arcade skins is really disappointing especially considering it's "the splash" and not "the splash_es_"

Not to mention Blitzcrank's claw is on the wrong side in his own version of the splash (pictured above)

**Edit:** A couple people pointed out that it looks like a fighting game loading screen, sans the "VS." It really needs a "VS" if that's the case to make it a bit more exciting. The shared splash is still a really lame trend though and I'd still like to see separate splash arts for these skins as they don't really fit together other than being thematic enemies (which should be reflected in the splash if they _must_ be together. They could be doing battle or something rather than simply posing à la fighting game loading screen.

Yes this is a homage to fighting game character select screens and will have a UI overlay. I don't know what the final plan is for it or why it's not on there yet, but I actually did a little bit of work on it so I know it exists. Often yes, it's lower scope skins that have combined splashes (although I do like that they allow us to show a group of skins in context), but occasionally an idea like this comes up that we think is genuinely cool. The other thing that happens is that while the splash is being worked on we go all out on a skin that was planned for a low scope and push it up because we have a great idea. This splash was done by Alvin Lee. The same Alvin Lee that worked for UDON on the Street Fighter and Darkstalkers comics so he absolutely loves fighting games!

I knew it!

I can't wait to see the final product. Initially I was averse to the idea of them sharing a splash, and even before this version of the splash was revealed I was thinking "oh please don't do the usual and give thim a shared splash." But the idea of the fighting game reference was introduced to me shortly after I started this thread and it's slowly worked into my brain parts as something that could absolutely be cool. A bit of hate came into this thread, but I still have faith in you guys! Not just in regards to splash arts, in all facets of your work!

I remember there were reservations about doing a shared splash at the time it was suggested, but we try to be open to anything if the people working on it have a lot of confidence in the outcome. I think it's really cool and very appropriate this time around but if someone said 'From now on Arcade skins are going to all share a splash like a fighting game' then there would be a lot of table-flipping in the office. It's fine to be critical and keep us accountable. I don't read the forums looking for praise, I like to provide insight where I can and see what really invested players opinions/reactions are.
